text: - Sorry. I didn't mean to scare you.
- Not until you want me to.
- Okay, we got Sameera's tofu bacon,
Harper's regular bacon, and Raffi's turkey bacon.
- Hey, if I pick up Harper and Sameera from karate,
will you grab Raffi from D&D?
- Yes, that just leaves Saleem's piano at 4:00.
- No more piano. I told you!
but, um, shouldn't we be teaching them to stick it out?
- All right, Raffi, grab your homework.
- Great news. I have a baby for you.
- What? You--you have, like, a real--
- You and Martin have 24 hours to report
to Brownsville, Texas to start the custody paperwork.
- That's--that's not a lot of hours, Roz.
- Breakfast now because we're leaving in two minutes!
I'm gonna have to call you back.
- So what do you think about piano lessons?
- Oh, you know, um, I support whatever you decide.
- You've got a dump and run in the bay.
- Oh, it hurts. Oh, God. - Okay, where does it hurt?
- It hurts everywhere. Please, just make it stop.
- I'm gonna need you to be more specific.
My clinical trial's coming up-- - You mean our trial.
Yes, you know what I mean.
But the startup costs are-- - I hear you.
We're not selling the proton beam laser.
- Cutting edge and cheap don't exactly mingle.
$40 million can go a long way--
- We're the only hospital in the tristate area
Where are all those patients gonna get treatment?
We are trying to change cancer treatment for millions.
- We're not there yet. - We could be.
we can make the proton beam laser obsolete
- That is the issue. It's not obsolete now.
- I really think you should recon--
- It's the only thing that works.
- What about the Percocet I prescribed?
After my last round of chemo, I--
I could barely get through the day unless I tripled up.
- Two weeks before my next refill.
I--I tried to find some on the street, but...
I guess this is-- this is my life now--
getting high with a bunch of junkies at the Dalton.
- Pain management is a part of cancer treatment.
There is no shame in that. Do you hear me?
I can make you comfortable while we treat your tumor.
- Can I have something now? It just--it hurts so much.
- We have to wait for your tox screen to come back
to make sure that the heroin wasn't laced with anything.
- I'm not gonna make it. I'm...
I'm gonna make sure of it.
- Has Tawan had any significant changes in his diet recently?
- And he's current on all his vaccinations?
- And he's had no dramatic weight loss?
- No, he's never had any health issues until now.
his teacher said he can't concentrate on anything
he started having these weird muscle twitches.
- We're gonna figure out what's wrong, okay?
- Well, what could be causing this?
- Well, I think we should order an MRI
- You must have a theory or guess.
it could be an early onset of MS.
- We'll know more once the tests come back.
- Your leg is late for a very important date.
You were supposed to be in pre-op 30 minutes ago.
any of your pre-op texts or calls,
- Okay, well, I have a cardio pulling up any second,
so I'm gonna have to reschedule my surgery.
- Nope, I'm here. I can hold down the fort.
- No offense, but actually-- - No buts, just legs--
- Doctor, doctor, please save my baby.
- Okay, let's get her to Trauma 1.
Where's Reynolds? - He's on his way.
- Maybe you let us handle this one.
Signs of tissue damage in the left lung.
- Dr. Duke, what does that indicate?
You have a clot in your lung.
That's why you're having trouble breathing.
- Why isn't anyone helping my baby?
- Ms. Alvarez... - Prep me some lidocaine.
- The fetus died en route. - Gabriela, turn towards me.
- The left ventricle was hyper plastic,
and there was stenosis in the aortic valve.
- You're gonna feel a slight pinch
- I'll need a central line kit.
And prep an infusion of TPA.
- What I'm about to say is...
is gonna be impossible to hear.
- I'm not--I'm not sure I understand it.
No, you didn't do anything wrong.
It's just that-- bad genetic luck.
The baby's heart never developed properly.
and there is nothing that anyone could've done
more than anyone ever wants to acknowledge.
- What do you mean stillbirth? She wasn't...
You mean I have to go through all of that
with no baby at the end?
Is there anyone that you'd like me to call?
It was just gonna be the two of us.
It's okay to say her name
- Don't you have lives to save
Thought maybe you could use a friend.
But actually, I have my mother.
- She doesn't even know when your birthday is.
- Well, she knows the month. That's progress.
It's one of my 12 steps to make amends with her.
She cared enough to show up, so...
Hi, uh, have you seen a woman who looks like me,
only immediately makes you feel bad about yourself?
- Lauren... - I am a big girl, okay?
I don't need balloons or a stuffed elephant
or my mommy to send me off to surgery.
- I am fine, okay? Go do your job.
Go! Go and do your job.
- Dr. Kapoor, I just got Tawan's test results back.
- Nothing in the labs or MRI points to MS.
but you should have listened more carefully to the answers.
In future, it's all right to offer a hypothesis,
but only if it's an informed one.
Get them off! They're on my face!
- He thinks there are spiders crawling all over him.
- Get them off! Get them off!
- Hold him still. - They're on you too!
- Hallucinations aren't a symptom of Schilder's.
- Dr Sharpe, did you discharge Shayna Davis?
- No, why? - I think she bolted.
No, no. I think I know where she is.
- Let me help you. - You can't.
this or the pain, and I cannot take the pain.
You're not gonna talk me out of it.
If you're gonna do this, then at least do it somewhere safe.
- Somewhere with clean needles and clean works.
- Oh, yeah? And what place is that?
You did it, Gabi. It's over.
but this is still your daughter.
the baby you have loved for months.
And it's okay to hold her,
even if it's just to say good-bye.
It's a special bassinet that keeps stillborn babies cool
so they can stay with their parents a little longer
These devices can give you something
- That thing can't give me time with Sofie.
- Not the time you wish you had.
but it can give you time to grieve.
You know, some parents keep a lock of hair
or make a footprint or take pictures--
all the things that you may have wanted to do,
doesn't mean that you can't have those memories,
I think when you lose someone that you love,
most of us would choose a few memories,
Do you want to talk to a grieve counselor?
- Do you want me to take her away?
I don't know what to say to his parents.
This case was not the piece of cake I was hoping it to be.
- I think we should go over his medical history with them
- No. Time for talking is over.
We need to perform the brain biopsy.
That's the only way to get his definitive diagnosis.
- Don't you think drilling a hole into his head
- We are running out of time, Agnes.
and page me when you find Dr. Chambers, okay?
- Dr. Bloom's tibia realignment looks good.
- I would say better than okay.
Dr. Bloom should have a relatively easy recovery.
can you keep my being here just between us?
I don't want Dr. Bloom to know.
- No, no. She knows that I care.
She just doesn't like it when I care.
Duke didn't show up for rounds today.
- I thought we were past this.
Um, I'm here to see Omar.
- Yeah, just meet me in half an hour.
- This is a safe consumption space.
without the threat of assault or rape,
and they're monitored by health care professionals
to minimize the risk of overdose.
- Omar, thank you so much for this.
- We have a cot over here for you.
and we've gotten better at evading the cops.
Can you, uh, can you show me your works?
- It okay. You can trust him.
- I need to test your product for Fentanyl to be safe.
I see you've not fully embraced the value of what we do here.
- I believe your intentions are good.
If people can start making good decisions here,
- I got a page. What happened?
- Room six. - Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.
- He's just moving her. - What? Why?
- We have another delivery coming in,
and we have to move Ms. Alvarez to post-partum.
- You said I could have more time.
- No, she gets to stay. - But Dr. Goodwin--
- You will if she asks you to. If not, you won't.
She can use every resource in this hospital
or none of them or anywhere in between.
and she gets to stay in this room with her daughter
As long as you need-- days, weeks.
- So what do I tell the OB's?
- That Gabriela Alvarez is not to be disturbed,
and if anyone has a problem with that,
they can come talk to me,
which'll be very easy because I'll be right here.
What, you too good to go on rounds now?
Where the hell have you been?
- I was trying to-- I wanted to help,
but I--I think--I think I just made things worse.
- Hey, hey, come here. What are you talking about?
- When we were in the ED,
I didn't know Ms. Alvarez's baby wasn't viable.
And when I saw her so-- so scared and worried,
- I told her we had the best doctors in the country...
and that her baby would be fine.
- Never promise a patient everything will be fine
because you never know what might happen.
I just-- - No more "I just," man.
Come on, this is day one stuff.
- But you always say patients need hope.
Without it, they don't get better.
- That's right. They don't. - So which is it?
How am I supposed to give someone hope
without telling them that we're going to help?
- Just be there for them, all right?
When they're waking up from surgery,
you don't even have to say anything.
- Will you come back to the hospital now?
If you told me a year ago
that I'd be jonesing for heroin
to manage the pain from a rare form of cancer,
I'd have thought you were crazy.
I should-- I should've called you.
- I am aware of who Ella is,
and you know that I can't talk to you about this.
- Do I look like I'm gonna tell you anything?
What I'm trying to tell over here is...
I know, I know. Vijay, I get it.
You're feeling helpless. You're feeling stressed.
We're all stressed. Hell, I'm stressed.
I contacted an agency about adopting another child,
and now they have a baby for me,
and I really, really want this baby.
But I haven't told Martin about it yet.
- I know. Ooh, this is bad.
I swear. I'm gonna tell him tonight.
- And now for the burr hole incision.
He has SSPE from the measles virus.
- We have confirmed a high level of measles antibodies
The virus has imbedded itself in his brain.
- Tawan was three years old when he came to the U.S.
while living in the orphanage in Thailand.
SSPE can lie dormant for up to ten years,
- We will do everything we can to help Tawan fight the virus.
- Every case of SSPE I've seen has resulted in--
Dr. Proctor asked me to come by and do a consult for Gabriela.
- She wants to be left alone.
- Yes, that is what grieving people say they want,
but it is not always what they need.
Sounds like Gabriela needs help saying goodbye to her daughter.
- She's not ready to say goodbye.
then her daughter will be gone forever.
- We still talking about Gabriela here?
- Don't do that. - Hey, I'm not doing anything.
Since the day you came back,
I've been running interference for you.
Telling people to give Max his space--
you know, not to project their needs onto you,
that you'll open up when you're ready.
- I don't want to open up.
- Yeah, I know. I can see that.
but that's the only way that you get better.
- Then I don't want to get better.
If I get better, then I have to let her go.
Where have you been all day?
what we're doing to do about the proton beam laser.
and I'm not having this conversation again.
As long as we are co-chairs of this department,
we both have a say on its direction.
- Excuse me. Are you Dr. Helen Sharpe?
- Please place your hands behind your back.
- You have the right to remain silent.
Anything you say can and will be used against you
You have the right to an attorney.
If you cannot afford one, one will be assigned to you.
If you choose to answer our questions,
you have the right to stop at any time.
- Thanks for the rescue. - What was I going to do?
Let you rot in jail on some trumped-up charges?
Don't worry. We took care of everything.
- And I kept it out of the press.
Do you know how many favors I had to call in tonight?
They have photos of you in a heroin den.
And because of it, my patient is in New Amsterdam
instead of dead on the street.
I am not gonna apologize for that.
- I don't care if you apologize,
but there will be consequences for this.
- The board will discuss your fate in the morning.
I thought she was on our side.
- I've seen so many children die in developing countries
parents did not have access to vaccines or--
or know they were important or--
with all its wealth and education
- There's a new treatment? - Very new.
- With a lot of anti-vaxxer kids coming of age,
It's forcing doctors to try new, untested treatments.
- This one is seeing a very limited success.
It's a combination of antiviral and immunomodulatory drugs.
You need to understand. SSPE has no cure.
Tawan will have to stay on these medications
for the rest of his life.
I'm just happy it might work.
- You will have to ask your doctor.
- She's the one who discovered it.
- Any available IV nurse to OR two.
Any available IV nurse to OR two.
Look who decided to finally show up.
Couldn't even be bothered to bring me any balloons
or a stuffed elephant, could you?
- Thought you didn't want me hanging around?
- Of course I want you hanging around.
- But hey, this is what I need you to do for me, okay?
- I need you to go down to the gift shop
so all the nurses think that people care about me.
- Come on. People care about you.
People do not care about me.
People are glad when I leave a room.
I don't know. I don't know what it is.
- Okay, just, uh-- first of all, stop that.
And if I didn't care about you,
why would I bring you this?
- My dad used to take me to Peter Lugers when I was a kid.
- When Jeanie was being extra Jeanie.
So now you've got to get better.
- You're gonna save some for me, right?
- Do I have to go? - No.
I'm just heading home for the night,
but everyone here knows you're not to be disturbed.
Keeping her close like this even though she...
You can hold her if you want.
but my head keeps telling me
you know, that that's not really her.
And then my heart tells me that's my Sofie.
All that matters here is you.
I feel like I'm not normal.
a few months ago, and it-
to what you're going through, but, uh...
And I--I know that people would say that's crazy,
that it's not healthy, but I--
what am I supposed to do?
right after our daughter was born.
She would've loved every second of it.
But she doesn't-- she doesn't get to.
She didn't get any of it.
You know, to make her a part of these memories.
I really don't care if it's healthy.
It's just what I have to do, you know?
My worry for you, Gabi, is that...
you will never say goodbye to Sofie...
- Guess who I talked to a little while ago?
- Our kids? Yeah, our kids are fine.
It seems that there's an issue with another kid--
a baby that, according to Roz,
- Yeah, you could if you were coming home tonight.
Iggy, I can't even look at you right now.

I think I figured out what I really want.
